Creating smooth transitions between sent.title: Creating smooth transitions between sentences.: Introduction - Thesis Statement

Ensuring subject-verb agreement.: Introd.title: Ensuring subject-verb agreement.: Introduction - Thesis Statement

GRM_SS_CORE_001.title: The student will be able to identify and correctly use subjects, verbs, and objects to construct simple, grammatically correct sentences.

GRM_VT_TENSE_001.title: The student will be able to identify and correctly use the simple, progressive, and perfect tenses (present, past, future) in basic sentences to clearly express when an action happens.

LIS_GEN_CORE_001.title: The student can identify the topic and speaker's purpose in a short, simple conversation.

LIS_NOTE_STRAT_001.title: The student will understand and be able to apply a basic, consistent system for taking notes using abbreviations and symbols to capture key information efficiently.

RD_GEN_STRAT_001.title: The student can identify the main topic and overall structure of a short passage by focusing on the first and last sentences of each paragraph and the title.

RD_QT_FACT_001.title: The student will be able to accurately identify and extract explicitly stated information from a short text to answer direct factual questions.

S1_Conclusion.title: Summarizing Your Preference and Key Points in a Brief Conclusion for Speaking Task 1

S1_Details_Examples.title: Providing Specific Details and Examples to Support Each Reason in Speaking Task 1

S1_Introduction.title: Crafting a Concise and Effective Introduction for Speaking Task 1

S1_Overall_Structure.title: Understanding the Overall Structure of Speaking Task 1 (Personal Preference)

S1_Time_Management.title: Managing Time Effectively to Address All Components within the 45-second Time Limit for Speaking Task 1

S1_Transition_Words.title: Using Transition Words to Connect Ideas Smoothly within Speaking Task 1

S1_Two_Reasons.title: Clearly Stating Two Distinct Reasons to Support Your Preference in Speaking Task 1

SPK_GEN_FLU_001.title: The student will understand and apply the 'Chunking' technique to break down sentences into manageable units, reducing pauses and improving fluency.

SPK_GEN_LANG_001.title: The student will be able to construct grammatically correct simple and compound sentences, understanding the role of conjunctions in connecting independent clauses.

SPK_GEN_PRO_001.title: The student will be able to differentiate between and accurately pronounce a small set of common English vowel and consonant sounds that are frequently mispronounced by speakers of their native language (assuming a generic 'Beginner' student).

SPK_GEN_PRO_002.title: The student will be able to identify and apply correct word stress in two-syllable nouns and verbs, and understand how sentence stress highlights important information.

SPK_T1_CONT_001.title: The student will be able to construct a simple sentence that clearly states their opinion or preference using a basic sentence template.

SPK_T1_ORG_001.title: The student will understand and be able to apply the basic three-part structure (Introduction, Body, Conclusion) to simple written or spoken responses.

SPK_T1_STRAT_001.title: The student will be able to consistently generate two clear, distinct, and relevant reasons to support their chosen preference in Speaking Task 1 within the 15-second preparation time.

SPK_T2_CONT_001.title: The student can identify the 'before' and 'after' states described in a reading passage and articulate the difference between them in a simple sentence.

SPK_T2_STRAT_001.title: The student can accurately identify the main proposed change and the two supporting reasons presented in a simple campus announcement.

S_CF_CohesiveDevices.title: Combine transitions, referencing, and logical connectors to create cohesive and coherent speech.

S_CF_LogicalConnectors.title: Use logical connectors (e.g., because, therefore, although) to show relationships between ideas.

S_CF_NaturalFlow.title: Maintain a natural flow of speech with appropriate pacing, intonation, and pausing.

S_CF_Referencing.title: Use referencing (e.g., pronouns, synonyms) to maintain clarity and avoid repetition.

S_CF_Transitions.title: Use transitions (e.g., however, furthermore, in addition) to connect ideas smoothly.

TTS_ALL_TIME_001.title: The student will understand the importance of time management on the TOEFL and be able to create a basic time allocation plan for each section.

Using varied and precise academic vocabu.title: Using varied and precise academic vocabulary.: Introduction - Thesis Statement

VOC_ACAD_AWL_001.title: The student will be able to identify and understand the basic meaning of 5-10 high-frequency words from the Academic Word List (AWL) in simple sentences and short paragraphs.

VOC_STRAT_CONT_001.title: The student will be able to identify and use different types of context clues (definition, example, synonym, antonym) to understand the meaning of unfamiliar words in simple sentences.

WRT_GEN_STR_001.title: The student will understand and be able to construct simple, compound, and complex sentences, recognizing their basic structures and using them to add variety to their writing.

WRT_GEN_STY_001.title: The student will be able to identify and replace informal language with formal alternatives in simple sentences.

WRT_GEN_TYP_001.title: The student can identify and correct their most common typing errors and implement strategies to improve typing speed and accuracy, ultimately enabling them to compose a full essay within the TOEFL time limit.

WRT_T1_CONT_001.title: The student can identify and clearly state the main topic and the central arguments of both the reading and the lecture in a concise introductory paragraph.

WRT_T1_STRAT_001.title: The student will be able to identify the topic sentence (main argument) and supporting sentences (key supporting points) in a simple academic paragraph.

W_Ind_Thesis.title: Crafting a clear and arguable thesis statement.: Introduction - Thesis Statement
